physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient was pale, appeared ill, had marked edema of the legs and periorbital region. Scattered nummular and erosive lesions with overlying eschar were noted on both feet, both forearms, and the medial right thigh; petechiae were also seen on the arms and chest.

Periorbital edema and purpura were seen, along with well-circumscribed erosions and nodules on both legs, with overlying crust in various stages of healing. The abdomen was soft, with no tenderness or organomegaly.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Marked edema noted on prior examination decreased slightly during admission.
